summary: This is a SweetFX/ENB combination I happened to create while trying to get a nice, performance friendly graphical setup for Skyrim. This is somewhat performance friendly - I usually get drops that dip down to 30 - 40 fps, but most of the time - it sticks around 50 -55. Enjoy!
descriptionHtml:
[center][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#9900ff][size=6][u]Welcome to Warm Fantasy ENB
[/u][/size][/color][/font]This ENB is a SweetFX/ENB combination that I happened to stumble upon while trying to create a nice and warm graphical
setup for my modded Skyrim. It uses the general effects from SweetFX, including bloom, HMR, vibrance effects, and SMAA.
The included ENB ( which utilizes the latest v.279 ENB binary by Boris Voronstov which can be downloaded [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0279.htm]here[/url]) is used for a wide range of things, from MOAR bloom,
godrays, additional lighting, reflections, Bokeh DoF effect, and ambient occlusion.

Thusly, it is not all that performance friendly. In the more graphically intensive areas, for example -- standing at the top of the Dragonsreach Stairway overlooking Whiterun -- there will be a substantial 10 - 15 frame drop, however most of the time it will be pretty stable. Indoor areas are typically around 55FPS - 60FPS, and outdoors are usually from 40 - 55 frames.

Keep in mind that my PC is in NEED of a new cpu, as I have a GTX 960 along with an old quad core Intel Core i7 930.
Taking that into account, if your CPU is Â ad least an i5 with 3 Ghz, or more, you'll probably do just fine -- even with a 700 series GPU.

Feel free to leave suggestions, and questions about the setup -- this is actually my first post, so I'm sure I missed some things.[/center]
author: Zhalek
